text: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
meaning: Joy comes largely from your own decisions and actions.
exercise: Write down one thing you can control today and act on it.

text: The biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place.
meaning: People often assume they were clear when they weren’t.
exercise: Ask someone to repeat back what they understood.

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
meaning: Steady progress is better than rushing and quitting.
exercise: Work on a goal for just two minutes today.

text: You are loved.
meaning: Your boyfriend loves you so much.
exercise: Ask him to show you his love.

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
meaning: Trying to copy others prevents you from living your own life.
exercise: List one personal trait you’re proud of.

text: If you’re going through hell, keep going.
meaning: Hard moments pass if you stay in motion.
exercise: Take one small step toward solving a problem.

text: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your actions.
meaning: Joy comes from habits, not chance.
exercise: Do one small act of kindness today.

text: Seek first to understand, then to be understood.
meaning: Good communication starts with listening.
exercise: Ask a clarifying question during your next conversation.

text: I can’t decide what I love more about you, your smile, your laugh… or the way you make my thoughts go places they probably shouldn’t in public..
meaning: It’s flirty, teasing, and let you know you have a strong effect on him.

text: Understanding is another name for love.
meaning: Real connection begins with empathy.
exercise: Ask someone what they need today.

text: Owning your story and loving yourself through it is an act of courage.
meaning: Self-acceptance takes bravery but leads to strength.
exercise: Write down one flaw you’ll treat gently today.

text: The world is full of suffering, but also full of overcoming it.
meaning: Hardship exists, but so does strength.
exercise: Remember a challenging moment you overcame.

text: Happiness is not a goal… it's a by-product.
meaning: Joy comes from meaningful action, not chasing joy itself.
exercise: Spend 10 minutes doing something meaningful.

text: Wise people speak because they have something to say.
meaning: Intentional communication is more powerful.
exercise: Pause one second before responding.

text: Absorb what is useful, discard what is not.
meaning: Improvement comes from filtering and tailoring what you learn.
exercise: Keep one idea from today and discard one unnecessary one.

text: Love is the only force capable of transforming conflict.
meaning: Kindness helps resolve tension more than force.
exercise: Practice a small act of patience toward someone difficult.

text: The privilege of a lifetime is becoming who you truly are.
meaning: Being authentic is one of life’s great achievements.
exercise: Write down one truth about yourself you appreciate.

text: The greatest glory lies in rising every time we fall.
meaning: Setbacks don’t define you—recovering does.
exercise: Turn one past failure into a written lesson.

text: Happiness comes from choosing the right actions each day.
meaning: Daily behavior shapes your mood over time.
exercise: List one good choice you’ll make today.

text: We have two ears and one mouth so we can listen more than we speak.
meaning: Listening is the most important communication skill.
exercise: Let someone finish speaking before you reply.

text: Continual growth gives life meaning.
meaning: Improvement never stops; it expands your potential.
exercise: Set one micro-goal for this week.

text: Love helps you see others at their deepest level.
meaning: Understanding someone requires genuine care.
exercise: Give one person your full attention for five minutes.

text: Man suffers because he takes everything too seriously.
meaning: Relaxing helps you accept yourself more easily.
exercise: Take a slow, deep breath and soften your posture.

text: I have not failed; I’ve just found ways that don’t work.
meaning: Mistakes are data, not personal flaws.
exercise: Write down one mistake you learned from today.
